string.text: Coonan .357 Magazine

Variant of the Colt 1911 magazine modified to adapt the much longer .357 Magnum round. Only works with the Coonan .357 handgun, which provides all the stopping power of the .357 Magnum cartridge in a compact package.
Standard 15-round Strayer-Voight Magazine

Standard magazine that comes with the Strayer-Voight Infinity Competition handgun. The extended 15-round magazine is designed to be quickly accessible to facilitate quick change of magazine: a small black speed plate is affixed to the bottom, and it is stamped with the SVI Diamond logo. One of these magazines in the outside world can possibly buy five or so Makarov PMs - however, value in the zone is determined purely by utility, and thus this magazine has no distinction besides being extremely rare.
Standard 17-round 9x19mm PX4 Magazine

Standard PX4 Storm Magazine. While highly similar to the Beretta 92F, the magazines have a slightly different feeding lip design which makes it incompatible with the 92F. Quite rare in the Zone, as is the case with its parent handgun.
Standard 10-round .45 PX4 Magazine

Standard PX4 Storm Magazine in .45 ACP. While highly similar to the Beretta 92F, the magazines have a slightly different feeding lip design which makes it incompatible with the 92F. Quite rare in the Zone, as is the case with its parent handgun.
9x19mm SIG P229 Magazine

Compact magazine designed to fit the SIG P229 handgun. The P229 is a very rare sight in the Zone, being an extremely modern handgun. More sensible stalkers carry handguns that are just as effective and not nearly as shiny, because minimizing attention is crucial no matter who you are.
9x19mm SIG P320 Magazine

Standard magazine designed to fit the SIG 320 handgun. The P320 is a striker-fired handgun like the Glock and Five-Seven, and more recently has been adapted by the U.S. Army as their standard duty handgun, designation M17. Limited quantities of the RXP variant were smuggled in by Nimble after hearing that certain American clients were making their way into the Zone.
.45 SIG P320 Magazine

Standard magazine fitting the SIG P320 handgun. The P320 is a striker-fired handgun like the Glock and Five-Seven, and more recently has been adapted by the U.S. Army as their standard duty handgun, designation M17. Limited quantities of the RXP variant were smuggled in by Nimble after hearing that certain American clients were making their way into the Zone. This variant of the magazine fits .45 ACP.
.45 Mark 23 Magazine

Oversized magazine from the equivalently hefty Mark 23-SOCOM handgun. Designed as a primary weapon, the Mark-23 is very accurate and stable, but extremely heavy, bulky and impractical as a sidearm, earning it the derisive distinction of being the world's first crew served sidearm. It seems that the rich stalker's appetite for rare guns outmatches his appetite for artifacts.
Modified 7.62x25mm Colt Magazine

A true odditiy, this is a Colt 1911 magazine modified to take the much skinnier 7.62x25 Tokarev cartridge. Only the Russian variants of the 1911 popular among Dutyers are capable of accepting such a modification. Proponents of the modification argue that the improved controllability of a smaller round combined with the commonality of the ammo make for a much more reliable sidearm, especially with the 1911's robust design. Detractors say that it is an unnecessary and patriotically motivated luxury, especially when cheaper options like the CZ 52 handgun exist.
Standard .45 S&W Magazine
Standard magazine for the Smith & Wesson 645 series of handgun. The 645 is popular as a privately purchased duty sidearm for American detectives and police officers.
Standard 9x19mm S&W Magazine
Standard magazine for the Smith & Wesson 659 handgun. THe 659 is effectively the 9mm variant of the 645 handgun, and as such the magazines are mostly identical.
Standard 9x19 XD9 Magazine
Standard 9-round magazine for the XD9 handgun. The XD9 is not a remarkable pistol by any measure except for perhaps cost effectiveness.
Standard .45 Glock 21 Magazine

Standard 13-round polymer magazine for the Glock 21. Due to Glock magazines being uniformly standard, this magazine also fits into Glock 17 handguns modified to take .45 ACP. How you were able to convert this magazine from a standard Glock magazine? Well, the Zone contains many secrets.
